page.title: 03TRANSPORT IN LYVEDEN
page.content:
We spent half an hour on the road holding a transport survey. We counted 17 vehicles (15 cars, 1 tractor and 1 van) and 7 aircraft (5 jets and 2 propellor driven planes). That makes an average of 34 vehicles an hour
and an average of 716 vehicles a day
(if we assume that there is the same amount of traffic throughout the day and night!) which is quite a lot because Lyveden is quite a secluded area. The road is a major route between the villages of Lower Benefield and Brigstock, although this might change once the new Brigstock bypass is open in 1986.
